meanings.definition: To allow or enable to escape or go: to release a prisoner.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper released the birds from their cages.
meanings.sent2: The police officer released the suspect after questioning.
meanings.sent3: The magician released a dove from his sleeve, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sun released its warm rays, melting the snow.
meanings.sent5: With a loud bang, the balloon released its air and flew away.

meanings.definition: To free from confinement, bondage, obligation, pain, etc.; let go: to release a prisoner; to release someone from a debt.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter released the trapped kitten from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The charity organization released the family from their financial burden.
meanings.sent3: After a long day at work, a warm bath can release all the stress.
meanings.sent4: The music released her from her worries, allowing her to dance freely.
meanings.sent5: The hug released a flood of emotions she had been holding back.

meanings.definition: To allow to be known, issued, done, or exhibited: to release an article for publication.
meanings.sent1: The company will release a new product next month.
meanings.sent2: The author released a statement clarifying the rumors.
meanings.sent3: The teacher released the test results, causing mixed reactions among the students.
meanings.sent4: The artist released a new painting that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The press release released important information to the public.

meanings.definition: To give up, relinquish, or surrender: to release an claim.
meanings.sent1: She decided to release her hold on the past and move forward.
meanings.sent2: The athlete released his title to the new champion.
meanings.sent3: The pirate released his treasure map to the eager adventurers.
meanings.sent4: He released his grip on the rope, letting it fall to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The company released its control over the project, allowing creativity to flourish.

meanings.definition: To set free from restraint, confinement, or servitude: to release a captive.
meanings.sent1: The activists worked to release the animals from the cruel conditions.
meanings.sent2: The key finally released the lock, granting freedom to the prisoner.
meanings.sent3: The genie released the trapped souls from the lamp, granting them wishes.
meanings.sent4: The storm released the town from its oppressive heat, bringing relief.
meanings.sent5: The hero released the kingdom from the tyrant's rule, restoring peace.
